Identity Management Costs
Identity Management Costs

• Costs are high
• Costs are high

– Procurement costs can range from $18-$100 per user,
– Procurement costs can range from $18-$100 per user,

depending on deployment size*
depending on deployment size*

– Implementation costs are, on average, 5x procurement costs* – Often not included are internal resource costs
– Implementation costs are, on average, 5x procurement costs* – I m p l e m e n t a t i o n
c o s t s
a r e ,
o n
a v e r a g e ,
5 x p r o c u r e m e n t
c o s t s *

• Adoption continues
• Adoption continues

So, What Changed?
So, What Changed?

• Identity Management evolved from an agent-based
• Identity Management evolved from an agent-based

to an agentless architecture
to an agentless architecture

– Large, expensive deployments hosted on OS/390 mainframes
– Large, expensive deployments hosted on OS/390 mainframes

– Moved to Service Oriented Architecture (SOA)
– Moved to Service Oriented Architecture (SOA)

– Agentless communication is becoming the norm for identity
– Agentless communication is becoming the norm for identity

management
management

© nCircle 2007 All rights reserved.
© nCircle 2007 All rights reserved.

So, What Changed?
So, What Changed?

• Identity Management’s evolution from an agent-
• Identity Management’s evolution from an agent-

based to an agentless architecture… … helped to model other IT systems’ evolution from agent-based to agentless architecture
based to an agentless architecture…
… helped to model other IT systems’ evolution from …
h e l p e d
t o
m o d e l o t h e r
I T
s y s t e m s ’
e v o l u t i o n f r o m
agent-based to agentless architecture

• Instead of having to physically examine a machine,
• Instead of having to physically examine a machine,

or load an agent on a machine, we can: – Create fine-grained, limited privilege accounts – Centrally consolidate these accounts
or load an agent on a machine, we can:
– Create fine-grained, limited privilege accounts
– Centrally consolidate these accounts

Security Auditing Leverages Identity Management
Security Auditing Leverages Identity Management

• Vulnerability Assessment, Vulnerability
• Vulnerability Assessment, Vulnerability

Management – Automated assessment of networked systems for vulnerabilities, e.g. buffer overflows, DoS, etc.
Management
– Automated assessment of networked systems for
vulnerabilities, e.g. buffer overflows, DoS, etc.

• Most VA/VM solutions provide remote testing without
• Most VA/VM solutions provide remote testing without

credentials – Assesses network-facing services and applications
credentials
– Assesses network-facing services and applications

• Thanks to IDM, some solutions can also perform deep
• Thanks to IDM, some solutions can also perform deep

system testing using credentials – Read-only registry and/or file access on Windows – SSH on UNIX, Cisco IOS, Linux, OS X, etc.
system testing using credentials
– Read-only registry and/or file access on Windows
– SSH on UNIX, Cisco IOS, Linux, OS X, etc.

© nCircle 2007 All rights reserved.
© nCircle 2007 All rights reserved.

Configuration Auditing Leverages Identity Management
Configuration Auditing Leverages Identity
Management

Before IDM, configuration auditing could only be accomplished using agents, and was therefore relegated to a small number of systems…
Before IDM, configuration auditing could only be
accomplished using agents, and was therefore relegated
to a small number of systems…

Configuration auditing discovers: 1. How IT systems are configured 2. Whether these configurations comply with established policy 3. How system configurations are changing 4. Whether these changes are OK or not
Configuration auditing discovers:
1. How IT systems are configured
2. Whether these configurations comply with established policy
3. How system configurations are changing
4. Whether these changes are OK or not

© nCircle 2007 All rights reserved.
© nCircle 2007 All rights reserved.

4. Evaluate Configuration Against Policy
4. Evaluate Configuration Against Policy

• Configuration of “gold image” • Rich library of policies from a variety of sources
• Configuration of “gold image”
• Rich library of policies from a variety of sources

– Prescriptive policies from CIS, NIST, and Microsoft – Regulatory policies such as PCI, HIPAA, and SOX – Emerging policies like Federal Desktop Core Configuration
– Prescriptive policies from CIS, NIST, and Microsoft
– Regulatory policies such as PCI, HIPAA, and SOX
– Emerging policies like Federal Desktop Core Configuration

© nCircle 2007 All rights reserved.

Agentless Configuration Auditing
Agentless Configuration Auditing

Identity Management has enabled organizations to audit system configurations on a network-wide basis
Identity Management has enabled organizations to audit
system configurations on a network-wide basis

– No agents to install on endpoints
– No agents to install on endpoints

– Agentless auditing provides complete coverage of all networked systems, not just major operating systems (unmanaged devices, infrastructure, IP phones, etc.)
– Agentless auditing provides complete coverage of all networked
systems, not just major operating systems (unmanaged devices,
infrastructure, IP phones, etc.)

– Greatly reduced political issues compared to installing agents on
– Greatly reduced political issues compared to installing agents on

systems managed by others
systems managed by others

© nCircle 2007 All rights reserved.
© nCircle 2007 All rights reserved.

File Integrity Monitoring
File Integrity Monitoring

Identity Management enables file integrity monitoring to be implemented on all applicable systems, at a reasonable cost
Identity Management enables file integrity monitoring to be
implemented on all applicable systems, at a reasonable cost

• Monitor files for security and compliance purposes
• Monitor files for security and compliance purposes

– Monitor file integrity and attributes for protection against trojans,
– Monitor file integrity and attributes for protection against trojans,

etc.
etc.

– Monitor file contents for compliance purposes – personal
– Monitor file contents for compliance purposes – personal

information, confidential information, etc.
information, confidential information, etc.

• Provides an audit trail of all file-level changes, including the identity of the account or username that made the change
• Provides an audit trail of all file-level changes, including
the identity of the account or username that made the
change

Why is the Enablement of
Agentless Technology Important?

• Discovery
• Coverage
• Network Context

Summary
Summary

Identity Management has evolved over the past decade into a de-facto solution
Identity Management has evolved over the past decade
into a de-facto solution

• The evolution of IDM has had cascading effects throughout IT,
• The evolution of IDM has had cascading effects throughout IT,

including security and compliance
including security and compliance

• The transition of IDM from a monolithic, proprietary, agent-
• The transition of IDM from a monolithic, proprietary, agent-

based system to an agentless system based on standards has both enabled and modeled a similar transition in other IT systems
based system to an agentless system based on standards has
both enabled and modeled a similar transition in other IT
systems

• The result is improved visibility and significantly reduced
• The result is improved visibility and significantly reduced

overhead required to collect data about systems on the network
overhead required to collect data about systems on the network
